normalised: Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra

unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution C O dot L T D dot has accelerated its smart meter installation drive, aiming to replace all conventional meters with smart alternatives by two thousand and twenty five. The initiative, crucial for reducing Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, is progressing steadily across key urban centres like Pune and Nagpur.

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has accelerated its smart meter installation drive, aiming to replace all conventional meters with smart alternatives by 2025. The initiative, crucial for reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses, is progressing steadily across key urban centres like Pune and Nagpur.
normalised: The advanced meters provide real-time data on energy consumption, empowering consumers to monitor their usage patterns and optimize electricity expenditure. M S E D C L officials confirmed that over five lakh smart meters have been installed as of seventeenth October two thousand and twenty three, with a target of two crore meters within the next two years.

unnormalised: The advanced meters provide real-time data on energy consumption, empowering consumers to monitor their usage patterns and optimize electricity expenditure. MSEDCL officials confirmed that over 5 lakh smart meters have been installed as of 17/10/2023, with a target of 2 crore meters within the next two years.
normalised: "This is a significant step towards modernizing our power infrastructure," stated a senior M S E D C L spokesperson at a press conference scheduled for eleven o’clock hours tomorrow. The project, estimated to cost rupee fifteen thousand crore, is being implemented in phases, with a focus on areas experiencing high transmission and distribution losses. Consumers can access their consumption data through the M S E D C L mobile app, promoting energy conservation awareness. The pilot project in Navi Mumbai, initiated on first April two thousand and twenty two, demonstrated a noticeable reduction in energy theft and improved billing efficiency.

unnormalised: "This is a significant step towards modernizing our power infrastructure," stated a senior MSEDCL spokesperson at a press conference scheduled for 11:00 hrs tomorrow. The project, estimated to cost Rs. 15,000 crore, is being implemented in phases, with a focus on areas experiencing high transmission and distribution losses. Consumers can access their consumption data through the MSEDCL mobile app, promoting energy conservation awareness. The pilot project in Navi Mumbai, initiated on 01/04/2022, demonstrated a noticeable reduction in energy theft and improved billing efficiency.
